central_thesis: This issue of The Scroll of Set details the ongoing evolution and practical application of Setian philosophy and magic, emphasizing individual Xeper (self-creation) through community engagement, specific magical projects, and ceremonial rites, while also addressing internal organizational dynamics and the challenges of defining Setianism to the uninitiated.

structure_content.summary: An overview of the Set-XIII Conclave, highlighting the growth and interaction of Setians, new recognitions of Masters and Priests, and the overall satisfaction with the progress of the Black Flame within the Temple. It underscores the unique, transformative experience of Conclaves for Initiates.

structure_content.chapter_title: Recognitions to the Priesthood of Set
structure_content.summary: Details the ceremonial recognition of new Priests of Set (William Van Patten and Paul McAtee) under the Temple's revised By-Laws, noting the new process of assessment by two Masters of the Temple as a crucial, Aeon-changing event for the organization.

Introduces the 'Drosophila Project,' a new Temple element focused on alchemical inquiry into human evolution across biological, cultural, and magical levels. It aims to facilitate self-transformation through Rites of Passage, Genealogy, Ethnography, and a 'World of Horrors' world-watch program, using the fruit fly metaphor to represent the Initiate's larval stage towards future states of Xeper.

A philosophical critique of conventional religions and materialistic philosophies, arguing that their understanding of the objective universe is flawed due to a subconscious fear of individual separateness. It asserts the self's unique existence and prerogatives, emphasizing the 'isolate intelligence' of Setians.

structure_content.chapter_title: From a Letter to the High Priest
structure_content.summary: Personal observations on the Set-XIII Conclave, noting the intense focus of discussions, the influence of the physical environment, and the profound impact of connecting the Black Mass ritual to the historical context of the Salem Witch Trials, creating a 'synchronization of different levels' of subjective and objective reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Problem of Understanding Between Initiates and Non-Initiates
structure_content.summary: Explores the difficulties Setians face in explaining their worldview (Xeper, constant becoming) to non-Initiates. It highlights the unique understanding shared among Initiates due to their 'isolate intelligence' and active engagement with personal experiences as initiatory tools, which distinguishes them from the 'profane'.

Describes two informal Setian groups: Hellraiser, dedicated to exploring the intersection of mathematics, metaphysics, and the fourth dimension; and Wirehead, focused on the magical implications of computer and communications technology, including virtual reality and encryption.

A detailed, practical ceremonial rite designed to commemorate a deceased Adept (Rick Ferguson), assisting their journey into the 'western lands of darkness' and honoring their Xeper. It includes specific invocations, symbolic actions, and the use of ritual tools to guide the spirit and provide comfort to mourners.

An in-depth exploration of 'Xem' as an advanced, exalted state of being within the Setian initiatory path. It defines Xem as a state that intrinsically incorporates the continuous process of Xeper, representing ultimate self-actualization and ongoing transformation beyond immediate goals, distinguishing it from other Words of the Aeon like Remanifestation and Runa.

A discussion on the necessity and value of constructive criticism within the Temple of Set. It argues that criticism, when serving organizational goals and individual Xeper, is vital for growth, preventing abuses of power, and ensuring the Temple remains on track.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian concept of self-creation, becoming, and constant self-transformation through the application of individual Will and the Black Flame. It is an ongoing, never-ending process.
The innate, divine spark or unique consciousness within each Setian that serves as the catalyst and driving force for their Xeper and self-deification.
The organizational and communal structure that supports Setian Initiates in their pursuit of Xeper, providing an environment for shared understanding and magical work.
A major gathering of Setians, described as a transformative experience for Initiates, facilitating discussions, rituals, and collective engagement in the Setian path.

A new initiative within the Temple of Set focused on alchemical inquiry into human evolution, aiming for self-transformation through biological, cultural, and magical studies, with the 'fly' serving as a metaphor for the larval stage of an Initiate's becoming.
An advanced, exalted state of being that is inseparable from and embodies the process of Xeper itself. It represents the ultimate, long-term self-actualization and continued evolution of the Setian.
The philosophical and magical tradition practiced by Setians, emphasizing individual will, self-mastery, personal deification, and conscious manipulation of reality for self-directed transformation.
A principle of truth, order, and righteousness, invoked in the 'Rite of Setian Passage' to weigh the deceased's words, heart, and endeavors, assessing their Xeper and ensuring an honorable passage.
The unique, inherent selfhood and distinct consciousness of Setians that sets them apart from the 'objective universe' and 'unthinking zombies,' serving as the foundation for their path of becoming.
Ritualized magical sequences marking significant life events and serving as thresholds for major leaps in self-transformation, a key area of focus within the Drosophila Project.

practical_system.description: The Scroll of Set outlines a system of self-deification and constant becoming (Xeper) through active engagement with philosophical concepts, community interaction (Conclaves), and specific magical workings. It encourages individual exploration, research, and application of magical principles to transform oneself and influence the objective universe. The Drosophila Project introduces a structured approach to alchemical human evolution, while the Rite of Setian Passage provides a specific ceremonial framework for commemorating deceased Initiates and guiding their continued journey.
tools: Black Flame (literal and symbolic focal point)
Blue feather of Ma'at (for truth/order symbolism)
Papyrus (for the deceased's name/journey in the Rite of Setian Passage)
MCI-Mail, Glinda subforum (for Drosophila project communication)
Books/literature (e.g., Ruby Tablet, Trail of the Serpent, Gems V for study)
Molecular biology & genetic engineering (conceptual tools for Drosophila)
Computer & communications technology (focus of Wirehead Project)
rituals: Ceremonial Recognitions of new Priests of Set
Black Mass / Mass of Terrible Justice (performed at Conclave)
Rite of Setian Passage (a detailed funeral rite for deceased Adepts)
Graal Ceremony (part of Rite of Setian Passage, involving a ceremonial drink)

relevant_quotes.text: Set-XIII is over, and those of you who were there can attest to the experience we call 'Conclave'.
The Drosophila Project can be seen as a system consisting of three essential interactive elements: (1) human evolution, (2) alchemy, and (3) the metaphor of the fly.
Ultimately, the goal is the Great Work, the Philosopher's Stone. It is the discovery and utilization of this knowledge, which transforms the baser metals of the self into gold.
The individual Black Magician to view his or her self as a larval stage toward future states of Initiation.

The Sacred Flame is lit, that which is the incessant drive to life. Let its fire burn into the netherworld, the roar of its course be heard as our brother's being travels the Tuat. Be mindful, O Setian, that this Flame ever burns brightly within, that it may enliven you even as your eyes close for the last time.

I believe it is that ancient Gift - the isolate intelligence. In a way we sensed our separateness from the objective universe by wanting to be what we are, and refused to dissolve our uniqueness into the mass of unthinking zombies.

Xem is a state of being. Assuming you are actively experiencing Xeper, one month from now you will have grown to a slightly higher state of being than you are now. One month later you will have grown to a still higher state of being. A year from now you will have a still higher state of being. Each of these future states can be called a Xem.
This dedication to causing changes in the objective universe is essential at all levels of the practice of the Left-Hand Path.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for understanding the practical and philosophical landscape of the Temple of Set in late 20th-century Western Esotericism. It provides direct insights into the organization's current projects, initiatory progression, ceremonial practices, and internal discourse, offering a unique snapshot of a living magical tradition in action. The emphasis on Xeper and individual transformation resonates strongly with broader Left-Hand Path principles.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is existing members and Initiates of the Temple of Set, seeking to deepen their understanding, engage with new projects, or participate in communal activities. It also serves as a valuable resource for academic researchers and practitioners of occultism interested in the specific doctrines, practices, and organizational dynamics of the Temple of Set.
